law.catch_line: A person may not process, sell, or keep for sale, as crab meat, anything that is not crab meat....

text.section: A person may not process, sell, or keep for sale, as crab meat, anything that is not crab meat.

A person may not process or sell for human consumption crab meat that:
Contains any filthy, putrid, or decomposed substance or is otherwise unfit for human consumption;
Has been packed or pasteurized in violation of this subtitle; or
Has been packed, prepared, or held under conditions that may have allowed the crab meat to become:
Contaminated with filth; or
Injurious to health.

section.section: A licensee may not possess, with intent to sell for human consumption, any crab meat, the processing or sale of which would be a violation of this section.
Possession by a licensee of any crab meat, the processing or selling of which would be a violation of this section, is presumptive evidence of intent to sell the crab meat for human consumption.
